name: Bauer Il Palazzo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was very enjoyable, comfortable and everyone particularly Paolo the Head Concierge and the Bell Staff were very helpful to us.
reviews.title: Magical Venice

likes.liked: — The location and quality old fashioned service
likes.disliked: — The prices: Venice room rates are outrageous but you get what you paid for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, please note in order to visit Venice and stay in quality accomodation, given the strength of the € against £ and $, you must expect it will be expensive. We booked a Panoramic Double Room with breakfast included: note that otherwise it would cost an additional €44 each.
reviews.title: all that glistens is not gold

likes.disliked: — Occasional rude staff, changeable bar prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had a balcony overlooking a Gondola station and provided a view of the City and Grand Canal. It was too cold to sit outside but this would have been wonderful in warmer weather.
reviews.title: SIMPLY OUTSTANDING !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious, the bed comfortable and the marble bathroom with separate shower was beautiful.
reviews.title: The best of Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was fine but we found the quality and service in the main restaurant on the ground floor better than the in the Il Palazzo facility which is adjacent to the roof terrance.
reviews.title: So disappointing !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is really poor : 3 hours to get our luggage ... one of our coat lost !
reviews.title: Exquisite

likes.liked: — The sense of luxury and personal attention
likes.disliked: — Changing bath towels three times a day seems a little excessive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No really overpriced and overestimated !
reviews.title: Bauer Il Pallazzo, I'll be back

likes.disliked: — small entrance made some times of day quite chaotic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't go overthere ! It's just pretentious and expensive !
reviews.title: Incredible views
Beautiful room
reviews.text: Had a wonderful trip to Venice, hotel is beautiful and staff are very attentive. The hotel could do with somewhere to sit and enjoy the sun . Paolo recommended a couple of nice restaurants for our evening meals. Amazing city! Gondola ride, although pretty expensive at 100 euros, was the highlight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took a train ride to Lake Garda on the sunday, very nice!
reviews.title: Romantic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (Take good walking shoes.)
reviews.title: Got Engaged

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When researching luxury hotels in Venice, I kept reading reviews of so-called 4 star or luxury hotels that did not live up to their rating, and also saw quite a few travelers' pictures of such hotels on this website that were scary. However, a couple friends had heard of Bauer Il Palazzo, and I didn't find anything too scary about it, so we went with it, despite the hefty price tag. The hotel did not disappoint. From our arrival, the staff was consistently friendly and helpful. We stayed in a deluxe double suite, which had a large king bed and walk-in closet, a nice sized sitting room (which we never used), a beautiful marble bathroom, and a spacious terrace with view of one of the side canals. My only disappointment with the room were the sheets--for such an expensive hotel, I would have expected luxuriously soft sheets, and these were not. Also, we had ants on the dresser in our room, but the staff immediately came and dealt with the problem when we notified them. The breakfast buffet, which was included with our stay, was pretty good, but the view from the rooftop terrace where you have breakfast was absolutely beautiful. You can reserve the rooftop jacuzzi with champagne and strawberries for one hour for a fee of 60 Euros. If you want to do this, book it in advance. It was completely booked both nights of our stay, but we were able to schedule an afternoon time, which ended up being perfect because it was about 80 degrees outside and sunny. The hotel also has a small but very nice exercise facility. I would definitely recommend the Il Palazzo.
reviews.title: we can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Prior to my going to Venice for my proposal, I carefully researched the different hotels including the Starwood properties, I ended up choosing the Bauer Il Palazzo.
reviews.title: Fabulous, but not for everyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: had a lovely stay hotel amazing although did ask for another room as was on side given suite, and had lovely 5 night stay.
reviews.title: fabbo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: st marcs square 5 mins walk, and so pleased we had private water taxi back and forth to from airport. didnt eat at hotel although breakfast was super. staff were so helpful and will definately return
reviews.title: Superb location, superb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything in Venice is expensive so put your qualms aside. This hotel is very nice and has the DISTINCT advantage of being in the middle of the most key section, yet being out of the way of the throngs that always seem to be moving through venice. There is something nice about fighting the crowds and then walking down the peaceful, almost secluded walk to the Bauer Il Pallazzo. Ladies, watch out, Prada is within arms length! Our rooms were spacious and wonderfully decorated, recently renovated, and lovely. The bathrooms were great and the service was excellent. The front desk got a bit crowded at times, but it was no worry. The rooftop breakfasts were great and the restaurant Da Pisis was crazy expensive but a GREAT place to lunch and look out over the grand canal. I will be staying at il Pallazzo next time I'm in Venice.
reviews.title: A Palace ? by virtue of its prices only...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: From the moment we walked in our room you wanted to cry because the view was so incredible.
reviews.title: Super elegant hotel in terrific location

likes.disliked: — outrageous price of internet access - 100 Euros a day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: I stayed at the Bauer Il Palazzo for 3 nights on May 17, 18 & 19, 2007. The hotel has a superb location on the Grand Canal, very close to St. Mark's, yet on a quiet side passage. I don't think there is a nicer place to stay in Venice if cost is not a concern.
reviews.title: Luxury on the Grand Canal

likes.liked: — An opportunity for a prime room with balcony on the Grand Canal.
likes.disliked: — Poor internet access for guests--and a charge of 15 euros per hour to boot.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I had a palatial room with full canal view and a balcony. Very expensive, but worth it for a splurge. I spent a lot of time on the balcony watching the diverse activities on the Grand Canal. Traditional Venetian decor. Large marble bath with separate shower. The hotel is well maintained to a very high level. Outstanding concierge--not only knowledgeable, but regularly going above and beyond what is expected even of a hotel of this quality. And this is quality--a solid 5 stars.
reviews.title: Romantic stay in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only weakness was only one computer for guest use by both Il Palazzo and the adjoining Hotel Bauer, and the computer was inoperative for two days during my stay. Fortunately, I found an excellent internet spot on Campo Santo Stefano, an 8-minute walk, with a rate of 3 euros for each 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Bauer Il Palazzo the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We always stay in five star hotels and we expected the Bauer Il Palazzo to be one but were disappointed. I read through the other reviews and will agree that the location is fantastic and the 7th floor breakfast and view are amazing but the rooms and staff at the front desk need to be spruced up. Our room was nice but a bit plain and in need of new carpet. For the price we paid, we feel the room should have been in better shape as well as the corridors. I will also agree with some reviews that the hotel front desk was a bit snobby (not all but a couple) which definitely leaves a negative impression. We thought this would be the best hotel during our two week italy vacation but it was not and we don't think we will return to it.
reviews.title: good, not great

likes.liked: — The breakfast and view from the 7th floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is probably not the most grand in appearance hotel in Venice, but it is definately one of the very best in service and attention to detail. The lobby and public areas are very nice but not "knock you off your feet" showy by any means. The rooms are very elegant and in the traditional venetian style. The Bauer next door is much more contemporary for comparison. My favorite experience at the hotel was the breakfast on the top floor overlooking the grand canal. The breakfast was of the best quality and the view was amazing. The most impressive quality of the hotel was the service. Every need was anticipated by the staff and they followed through with every request. When waiting for the boat to come get us to take us to their sister property, they not only showed us outside to sit, but came for us when the boat arrived even though we could see the boat in view adjacent to us. At night the turn down service was royal style with slippers and a linen layed out on the floor on each side of the bed to step on so your feet never had to touch the floor ! The amenities in the room were luxury soaps, lotions and shampoos. I honestly have not stayed in a hotel any better in the way of service. To me, I would probably say service is the most important factor when you consider the rooms are always nice in a 5 star anyway, just vary in size and decor. So, this hotel def. owned up to it's 5 star status !! kudos go out to the entire staff !!
reviews.title: Top notch service and hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Bauer for two nights in Venice and loved it! Knowing that many european hotels are small, I expected the smaller room given, and the management allowed me to look at a larger room! We kept our smaller room as it had a lovely balcony with sweeping views of the city and water.
reviews.title: Bauer il Palazzo is the lovely boutique I expected

likes.liked: — The room - a/c, shower, sheets and cleanliness

description: Bauer Il Palazzo is one of Venice’s most luxurious hotel. It is an authentic 18th century palazzo with the most spectacular vantage point in Venice - close to St Mark’s Square, facing the Grand Canal and overlooking St Mark’s basin. The 82 luxurious rooms including 38 suites, many with balconies or terraces, have been recently restored with the finest fabrics, gilt mirrors, carved stucco ceilings and Murano glass chandeliers. Located on the top floors of the historic palace guests have the option of staying in one of Bauer Il Palazzo’s re-designed rooms or executive suites. The interior design concept of the guest accommodations on the 6th & 7th & 8th floors is quite distinct; each room is decorated in a unique sleek style, with comfort.
